gamenews.headline: Your Return to Tibia
message: You have chosen a great time to return to Tibia. Exciting new adventures are waiting for you!
Here are three tips to get you started:
<td style="width: 297px; text-align: center;">TIP #1: See what Thais has to offer!
Thais is a good central starting point to explore the Tibian lands.
Let's have a look at a few interesting places close to you:
<td style="width: 474.183px; height: 5px;" valign="middle">Use reward shrines to pick up daily rewards for your character.
<td style="width: 474.183px; height: 5px;" valign="middle">Unlock imbuing to temporarily boost your equipment via imbuing shrines.
<td style="width: 474.183px; height: 5px;" valign="middle">Visit depots to access your global depot chest, your global inbox, your stash and the Market where you can trade with other players.

<td style="width: 474.183px; height: 5px;" valign="middle">Use training statues or house beds to log out and train your skills while being offline. In Thais, these statues are scattered throughout the city. We have marked their location on the mini map in the picture above.

<td style="width: 474.183px; height: 5px;" valign="middle">Visit the Tibiadrome to fight for fun without death penalty. Stand your ground against monster hordes and compete for special rewards and extraordinary potions.
<td style="width: 296px; text-align: center;">TIP #2: Get a free adventurer's stone!
Ask temple NPCs, such as Quentin in Thais, for anadventurer's stone.

If you use this stone in a temple, you will be teleported right to the Adventurers' Guild. There, you can find lots of helpful things and NPCs in one place, e.g.: offline training statues, a daily reward shrine, and a banker.
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 648px;" cellpadding="5">
Enrich your game experience by teaming up with others.
<li>Hunt in parties, share XP and face mighty bosses together.
<li>Participate in world events and help your world succeed.
No matter if you're looking for hunting advice, equipment recommendations, or just exciting stories - Tibians have a wealth of knowledge to share.
• Chat ingame or interact with fellow Tibians via theofficial forum,fansites, theTibia facebookpage or other social networks.
• Watch how others play Tibia and see what tips they have to share in their streams and videos onTwitchand Youtube.
<td style="width: 296px; text-align: center;">TIP #4: Check the Char Bazaar!
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 648px;" cellpadding="5">
Do you want to continue your Tibian adventure with a character that has a higher level and skills, or even a different vocation?
Character auctions allow you to acquire other players' characters or sell your own in a secure and easy-to-use way via theChar Bazaar. Browse through the offers or even create your own.
More info can be found in the Compendium entry about character auctions under "Game Contents" or in therelease news.
Now go forth, brave adventurer, and shape your own Tibian story!
We are glad to have you back.

gamenews.headline: Battle List
message: <center>The battle list shows all characters and monsters in your current battle range.
Use it to attack your targets accurately!
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
Pressor click the battle list button to open the battle list in your sidebar:
<table style="height: 150px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="168" cellpadding="5">
If you press Spacebar in Chat Off mode, you will attack the next target in your battle list.
You can also set your own hotkey for this.
<table style="height: 27px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="57" cellpadding="5">
Battle list filters allow you to show or hide members of eleven different groups:
players, knights, paladins, druids, sorcerers, summons, NPCs, monsters,
non-skulled players, party members, and players of your own guild.
<table style="height: 146px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="193" cellpadding="5">
You can also sort the creatures shown in your battle list by certain critera.
<table style="height: 235px; width: 323px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" cellpadding="5">
Left-click on a creature to attack, right-click on it to open the context menu with further options.
<table style="height: 27px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="57" cellpadding="5">
You can also create secondary battle lists.
<table style="height: 27px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="57" cellpadding="5">
Any secondary battle list will have a plus sign in its icon. Its name is of a darker grey, while the main battle list's name is bright grey.
<table style="height: 27px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="57" cellpadding="5">
You can rename your battle lists to make them easier to identify.
<table style="height: 27px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="57" cellpadding="5">

gamenews.headline: Imbuing
message: <center>Imbuing allows you to temporarily boost your equipment!
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
<table style="height: 139px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 400px;" cellpadding="5">
Visit Albinius north of Thais, collect heavy old tomes for him and hand them over via the key wordtempleto unlock the ability to use imbuing shrines.
Items with imbuement slots can be imbued. Look at an item to see if it has any slots.
<table style="height: 93px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="265" cellpadding="5">
Depending on the item, different imbuements are available:
<table style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 50%; height: 28px; border-width: 0px;" border="0"><colgroup><col style="width: 100%;"></colgroup>
Imbuements vary not only in effect but also in power.
Get Premium to apply intricate imbuements and unlock more powerful imbuements through quests!
Click on an imbuing shrine in a city temple to open the imbuing dialog.
Select "Pick Item" and click on the item you want to imbue.
<table style="height: 266px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 684px;" cellpadding="5">
Select one of the imbuements that are available for your item to see the required astral resources and gold.
If you have the required resources and gold, click the green arrow on the right side to imbue the item.
Since the summer update 2025, imbuing an item always succeeds.
For most imbuements, time only decreases when the imbued item is equipped during combat.
<table style="height: 152px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 684px;" cellpadding="5">
You can also imbueblank imbuement scrolls to create intricate and powerful imbuement scrolls that can be traded.
Click on an imbuing shrine and select "Imbue Scroll" to set it up.
An imbued scroll can also be used by a free account player.
If you want to remove all imbuements from an item before they have run out, you can buy a cleansing scroll from Albinius.

gamenews.headline: Prey Creatures
message: <center>Activate a prey to gain a bonus when hunting certain monsters!
Pressto open the prey dialog.
(1) You can also click the prey button to open the prey window in your sidebar.
(2) Left-click in the prey window to open the prey dialog.
Select your prey or click here if you want to reroll the monsters to choose from:
You get a free list reroll every 20 hours. The gold price for a list reroll depends on your character level.
Once you have selected your prey, click here to activate it and get a random bonus: damage boost, damage reduction, bonus XP, or improved loot.
If you are looking for a specific monster, you can use five Prey Wildcards to directly select the prey of your choice.
Use a Prey Wildcard to reroll your bonus to get one with a higher value.
Prey Wildcards can be purchased for Tibia Coins in the Store or can be obtained at the reward shrine.
You want a different prey but would like to keep your current bonus?
Roll for a new monster list while you already have an active prey. Select a new prey from the list and activate it. Your hunting time will be reset to 2 hours.
You want a different bonus but would like to keep your current prey?
Roll for a new bonus while you already have an active prey. Your hunting time will be reset to 2 hours with your new bonus.
Tick the option "Automatic Bonus Reroll" to have your prey bonus
rerolled automatically whenever it is about to expire.
Each Automatic Bonus Reroll consumes one of the Prey Wildcards.
You have found your perfect prey and bonus combination?
Tick the option "Lock Prey" and your prey time will be set back whenever it is about to expire.
Each time the Lock Prey option triggers, it will consume five of your Prey Wildcards.
The prey window shows your current prey, your bonus and the remaining time for the prey.
Hover over your prey for a tooltip with details.
By the way: Prey time only decreases while hunting!
You can activate up to 3 preys simultaneously.
All players can use the first prey slot, Premium players can also use the second slot. Additional prey slots can be unlocked permanently by purchasing them for Tibia Coins in the Store.

gamenews.headline: Loyalty System
message: <center>Being a loyal premium player grants you additional rewards.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
Every already used premium day on your account equals one loyalty point. You can check your loyalty points on your account page under General Information.
<table style="height: 150px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="168" cellpadding="5">
Depending on the number of loyalty points on your account, you may receive an honourable title, appear in the loyalty highscores or even enjoy a bonus of up to 50% on your skill points.
<table style="height: 39px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="193" cellpadding="5">
If you have earned yourself a place in the loyalty highscores, you can select which of your characters should be displayed there.
Clickon your account page to open your account management.
<table style="height: 266px; width: 564px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" cellpadding="5">
Click onLoyalty Highscore Characterin the navigation bar or scroll down to the respective section.
Select the character of your choice via the dropdown menu. You can only select characters that are not hidden.
You will appear in the loyalty highscores of the game world your selected character belongs to.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
The manual on our website provides you with more details about theloyalty system, including a list of all titles you can earn and an example of how the skill bonus exactly works.

gamenews.headline: Need Help?
message: <center>A wealth of information is available to help you find your way around in Tibia.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
Hover your mouse cursor over a button or a bar in the client interface to have a tooltip appear.
<table style="height: 65px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="590" cellpadding="5">
Turn your mouse cursor into a magnifying glass by pressing
<table style="height: 205px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 498px;" cellpadding="5">
<td style="width: 95.0167px;" valign="middle">Now hover over certain elements of the client to get additional information displayed.
You can also select the Help section in the Options menu to get ingame help or to access specific help sections of the Tibia website.
TheGet Helpsection on our website provides you with useful links to various topics related to the game itself and your account.

gamenews.headline: Action Bars
message: <center>Make use of the buttons in your action bar to quickly trigger actions or messages.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
Action bars are displayed below your game window.
Right-click on an action button to assign a spell, object, text or hotkey to it.
<table style="height: 105px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="110" cellpadding="5">
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 317px; width: 607px;" cellpadding="5">
(1) Click onAssign Spellto open a small window listing the various spells. Select a spell.
(2) Click OK to assign it to the action button. You can now trigger the spell by clicking on this button in your action bar.
You can also open the spell list window via the control buttons below your inventory to assign a spell by dragging and dropping it on an action button.
If you selectAssign Object,your mouse cursor will turn into a crosshair.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 350px; width: 722px;" cellpadding="5">
Click on an item to assign it to the action button. Choose your preferred action in the window that will pop up.
You can also drag&drop an item on an action button to assign it.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 266px; width: 525px;" cellpadding="5">
(1) Click onAssign Textto open a small window where you can enter text.
(2) Click OK to assign the text to this action button. If you want to send the text right away when clicking the action button, selectsend automaticallybefore hitting OK.
You can also assign a hotkey to an action button to trigger it via this key.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 327px; width: 792px;" cellpadding="5">
(1) Click onAssign Hotkeyto open this window. Press the key or key combination you want to assign.
(2) Click OK to assign the hotkey to this action button. The hotkey will be displayed in the upper right corner of the action button.
Use the small arrow buttons on the left and right side of an action bar to navigate through it.
<table style="height: 31px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 530px;" cellpadding="5">
Clicking the small lock on the right allows you to lock or unlock the ability to assign actions via drag&drop.
You can adjust your general action bar settings via the Options menu. You can have up to three action bars on the left, right, and bottom with 50 action buttons per bar.
<table style="height: 65px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="148" cellpadding="5">

gamenews.headline: The Store
message: <center>The Store offers a wide range of Tibia products that you can buy without having to leave the game.
<center>Purchases are made with Tibia Coins, a special currency in Tibia.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
Click on this button below your inventory to open the Store.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 40px;" width="123" cellpadding="5">
You can check you current balance of Tibia Coins here:
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 43px;" width="354" cellpadding="5">
Tibia Coins can be bought in our Webshop. Click this button to open the Tibia website in a browser window and log in to access the Webshop.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 43px;" width="316" cellpadding="5">
You can also buy Tibia Coins from other players ingame via the Market.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 346px; width: 502px;" cellpadding="5">
Click on a category to see the products within it. Some categories have subcategories (indicated by a small arrow) for easier navigation.
If a product and its Buy button are greyed out, the product is currently not available for your character. Hover of the Buy button to find out why.
Please note that products which cannot be used by your character at all, e.g. due to a vocation restriction, will not be displayed.
(1) In some categories, you are able to filter products further by clicking on "Show All" and selecting the filter of your choice.
(2) You can also change the display order of products via the right dropdown menu.
You can also use the search function in the Store if you are looking for specific products.
To buy something, select the product of your choice and click the Buy button. Confirm your purchase by clicking Buy in the next window.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 255px;" width="339" cellpadding="5">
Check the box "Do not show this dialog again!" if you want to buy products instantly without any confirmation.
You can also change this setting via the General Options menu.
After a purchase, click this box to open it and close the window to continue.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 112px;" width="331" cellpadding="5">
Portable items you have bought in the Store (e.g. potions) will be sent to your Store inbox.
You can open the Store inbox wherever you are.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 210px; width: 651px;" cellpadding="5">
Items purchased in the Store can only be used by the character that purchased them.
Pieces of furniture or decoration bought in the Store can only be unwrapped in a house owned by this character.
You can also use the Store to gift Tibia Coins to other accounts.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 112px;" width="331" cellpadding="5">
ClickHistoryto see a history all of your Tibia Coins transactions.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 50px;" width="270" cellpadding="5">
Curious how a certain outfit or mount would look on your character?
Select the mount or outfit of your choice and click the "Try On" button to open a preview dialog. Here, you can try out various combinations of outfits and mounts.
You can also rotate your character in the preview window to see it from different sides and you can preview walking or riding animations.
Please note that any settings or combinations you select via the "Try Outfit" dialog will neither be saved nor trigger a purchase.
If you want to buy an outfit or mount you need to click the "Buy" button in the Store.
<td style="width: 195px; vertical-align: top;">If you want to actually change your character outfit, its colours or your mount ingame, use the "Set Outfit" dialog.

gamenews.headline: Hotkeys
message: <center>Hotkeys allow you to quickly trigger actions by pressing a specific key or key combination.
Define hotkey presets for your characters to optimise your gameplay!
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
You can have the hotkey preset for a specific character automatically activated upon login.
Pressor open the Options menu and go to the Hotkeys section. Check this box:
<table style="height: 80px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="253" cellpadding="5">
Either clickAddto create a new hotkey preset orRenameto change the name an existing one.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 75px;" width="192" cellpadding="5">
Make sure to name the hotkey preset exactly like the character it is meant for and click OK. Done!
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 75px;" width="192" cellpadding="5">
There are two chat modes in Tibia. This is important to know for your hotkey presets.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 354px; height: 328px;" cellpadding="5">
You can write text in the chat console.
If you have assigned an action to a letter key (e.g. A), pressing this key will trigger the action but you will not be able to type the letter in the entry line of the chat console.
You cannot write any text in the entry line of the console.
Per default, you can walk with WASD in this mode.

This temporary mode is a special case. Per default, if you press the Return key in Chat Off mode, it temporarily switches to Chat On* so that you can write one message in the console. As soon as you press Return to send the message, your chat mode will be set to Chat Off again.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 593px; height: 128px;" cellpadding="5">

<td style="width: 403.433px;" valign="middle">The small button on the right side of the entry line of the chat console tells you which chat mode is currently active. Click it to switch between the two chat modes.
To assign and edit hotkeys, first select the hotkey preset you want to edit.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 74px; width: 303px;" cellpadding="5">
Now select the chat mode for which you want to edit hotkeys:
If you want your hotkeys to work in both modes, you need to set them in both modes!
So this basically means that you have to set up your hotkeys twice.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 523px; height: 81px;" cellpadding="5">
Check the boxShow Advanced Optionsto access all hotkeys via the three hotkey subsections under Controls: general hotkeys, action bar hotkeys and custom hotkeys.
If you leave the box unchecked, only basic options will be displayed in the Options menu. With this setting, you can only assign hotkeys to predefined actions via the buttonHotkeys.
If you have checked the boxShow Advanced Options,
you can set your personal hotkeys in the subsectionCustom Hotkeys.
Click onNew Actionand select the action of your choice.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 179px; width: 647px;" cellpadding="5">
(1) Click onAssign Spellto open a small window listing the various spells. Select a spell.
(2) Click OK to close this window.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 179px; width: 649px;" cellpadding="5">
If you selectAssign Object, your mouse cursor will turn into a crosshair. Click on an item and choose your preferred action in the window that will pop up.
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 197px; width: 776px;" cellpadding="5">
(1) Click onAssign Textto open a small window and enter your text message.
(2) Click OK to close this window. If you want to send the text right away when clicking the action button, select send automatically before hitting OK.
Now we need to actually assign a hotkey to the action we just selected:
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 133px; width: 737px;" cellpadding="5">
(1) To do so, click on the small pencil icon in the fieldFirst Key. This will open a window where you can edit the hotkey.
(2) Press the key or key combination of your choice.
(3) Click OK to close this window.
You can assign up to 2 hotkeys to every action. You need to have a hotkey assigned in the columnFirst Keyto be able to assign a hotkey in the column Second Key.
Always remember to save your hotkey changes and settings before closing the hotkey dialog!
To do so you can either click Apply to save your changes or click OK to save your changes and close the dialog.
If you are looking for a specific hotkey in a hotkey section, you can also use the search bar.
How to assign a hotkey to toggle between Chat On an Off:
<table style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 140px; width: 470px;" cellpadding="5">
• Sethotkey preset for chat modeto Chat Off, scroll to the predefined actionChat Mode: Set to Chat On. Assign the hotkey of your choice.
• Sethotkey preset for chat modeto Chat On, scroll to the predefined actionChat Mode: Set to Chat Off. Assign the same hotkey.
<li>Click Apply to save or OK to save and close the hotkey dialog. Pressing this hotkey now toggles between the chat modes.

gamenews.headline: Summer Update 2017
message: If you would like to find out more, check therelease newson our website.
Also, new Compendium entries have been added to explain the new features Daily Rewards, Analytics Tools, Quest Tracker, and Cyclopedia further.

gamenews.headline: Daily Rewards
message: <center>Pick up daily rewards for your character and enjoy certain bonuses if you do so on consecutive days.
Reward shrines can be found in the temples of all major cities in Tibia and in the Adventurers' Guild.
<table style="height: 202px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 637px;" cellpadding="5">
Use a reward shrine to open the reward wall and collect your reward directly for free.
You can also purchase a reward shrine for your own four walls in the Store. Unwrap it in your house to be able to collect your daily reward from there.
If you have premium status, you will receive better rewards and are able to unlock more bonuses if you collect them on consecutive days.
Simply hover over a reward for further info on its free and premium version.
<td style="width: 267px;">You can also click the reward wall button below your inventory to open it wherever you are.
In this case, though, you can only pick up your reward if you use anInstant Reward Access, which you can buy in the Store.
It shows the rewards and the order in which you will be able to claim them during one reward cycle.
To advance in the reward lane, you need to pick up the reward that is currently available for you.
Once you have reached and claimed the final reward, a new reward cycle will start which means you will start at the beginning of the reward lane again.
<td style="width: 306px;" valign="middle">If you have collected a reward, check the timer below the next reward to see when you will be able to claim it.

Rewards that are objects (e.g. potions) are directly delivered to your Store Inbox. Please note that some items expire if not used within a certain time frame. Just click on an item to look at it for further info.
You can access your Store inbox via this button:
If a reward can be collected, check the box below it to see if it costs you an Instant Reward Access to pick it up directly:
<table style="height: 391px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 636px;" cellpadding="5">
<td style="width: 302px; height: 209px;" valign="top">If you open the reward wall via a reward shrine, you can claim your reward for free:

<td style="width: 302px; height: 209px;" valign="top">If you open the reward wall via the respective button, a 1 is displayed below the reward which means you need an Instant Reward Access to collect this reward directly.

In the lower left corner of the reward wall, you can check the number of Instant Reward Access currently available to you. If you do not have any left, click on the button next to that info box to open the Store and buy some with Tibia Coins.
Pick up your reward on consecutive days to unlock special bonuses in resting areas such as regeneration of hitpoints, mana, stamina or soulpoints.

(1) Here you can see on how many days in a row you have collected your reward. As long as you pick up your daily reward once during each server cycle, your reward streak will increase. A server cycle is the time between two regular server saves.
(2) Hover over the dragons to get further info on currently unlocked bonuses and those you will unlock if your reward streak increases.
You will keep all your unlocked bonuses as long as you do not break your reward streak.

Check the reward wall to see how much time you have left in the current server cycle to pick up your reward without breaking your reward streak. Once you have collected your reward for the current server cycle, a green check mark will appear.
If you miss to collect your reward during a server cycle, your reward streak will be reset to the first bonus as soon as you pick up your next daily reward.
<table style="height: 210px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 571px;" cellpadding="5">
Resting areas can be found in the temples of all major cities, in the Adventurers' Guild, in player houses and in most depots.
Whenever you are in a resting area, a special status icon will appear beneath your inventory. Hover your mouse cursor over it to check your active bonuses.
Keep in mind that you need to eat something for regeneration bonuses to work.

gamenews.headline: Analytics Tools
message: <center>Analyse and optimise your hunting sessions by making use of various statistics.
<table style="height: 153px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 576px;" cellpadding="5">

<td style="width: 297px; height: 116px;" valign="middle">Click on the respective button below your inventory to access the analytics window in your sidebar. Click the Analyser tools you want to use to open them.
Make good use of the additional sidebars you can open on the left and right side of your screen.
<table style="height: 293px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 605.5px;" cellpadding="5">
This analyser summarises important values of your current hunting session.
A hunting session starts when you log in, and ends when you log out.

You can start a new session at any time via the small button in the upper right corner. Please note that previously collected data will be discarded and the data in all other Analytics tools will be reset if you start a new hunting session.
You can also copy your session results to your clipboard, or save them to a .txt or .json file via this menu to share them with your friends and enemies.
<table style="height: 293px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 605.5px;" cellpadding="5">

This analyser is similar to the Hunting Session Analyser. It however not only summarises important values of your current hunting session, but of everyone in the party. On the other hand, it is not as detailed as the Hunting Session Analyser. An overview of the party's combined data is also given.

A session starts once a party is formed. You can reset the data at any time via the small button in the upper right corner. Please note that previously collected data will be discarded and the data in all other Analytics tools will be reset if you start a new hunting session.
Premium players who are also the party leader can switch between loot types "Market" and "Leader", which affects how the values are calculated.
You can also copy your session results to your clipboard via this menu to share them with your friends and enemies.
<table style="height: 199px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 652px;" cellpadding="5">
It lists all items you have marked for tracking in the Cyclopedia and tells you how many of them you havelootedsince tracking was started. ClickAdd Tracked Dropto add items via the Cyclopedia.
Free account players can track up to five items at once per character, premium players can track up to 50 items at once per character.
If a monster drops an item you have marked for tracking, you will be notified about it in the drop tracker and the loot channel. Also, a message will pop up at the bottom of the game window.
<td style="width: 369.817px;" align="center">As long as the notification is visible in the drop tracker,
you can hover over it to see when this item dropped.
If several party members track the same item, all of them will be notified whenever the item is dropped by a monster.
<table style="height: 164px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 635px;" cellpadding="5">

As a premium player, you can also specify a minimum gold value for items you want to have tracked automatically in the drop tracker. Click the small button in the upper right corner of the window to set a value.
If you are already tracking the maximum amount of items (50), newly dropped items that exceed this value will not be displayed in the drop tracker.
<table style="height: 293px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 605.5px;" cellpadding="5">

This analyser allows you to keep track of items looted during your play session and the resulting profit in gold coins based on the NPC price, average Market price on your world or your individually set price.
You can change the loot value source via the Cyclopedia.
If you click on the small button in the upper right corner, you can also set a target value of your choice.
Use the gauge to track if your current performance is above or below your defined target. Use the graph to see your performance over the last 60 minutes.
<table style="height: 293px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 605.5px;" cellpadding="5">

This analyser shows your current usage of certainconsumables, e.g. potions, runes, or consumed food, and the resulting loss in gold coins based on the NPC price, average Market price on your world or your individually set price.
You can change the loot value source via the Cyclopedia.
If you click on the small button in the upper right corner, you can also set a target value of your choice.
Use the gauge to track if your current performance is above or below your defined target. Use the graph to see your performance over the last 60 minutes.
<table style="height: 293px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 605.5px;" cellpadding="5">
This analyser shows your current damage and healing performance.
If you click on the small button in the upper right corner, you can choose to display your recent damage or healing values or your average output for the whole session.

You can also set a target value of your choice via this button. Use the gauge to track if your current performance is above or below your defined target. Use the graph to see your performance over the last 60 minutes.
This analyser shows your current XP per hour rate and the remaining time to reach the next level.
<table style="height: 252px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 627px;" cellpadding="5">
If you click on the small button in the upper right corner, you can also set a target value of your choice.
Use the gauge to track if your current performance is above or below your defined target. Use the graph to see your performance over the last 60 minutes.
This widget allows you to keep track of the remaining cooldown time of Archfoe bosses which you have killed at least once.
<table style="height: 252px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 627px;" cellpadding="5">
You can either sort unlocked Archfoes by remaining cooldown time or by name. And if you want to check the Bosstiary entry of one of the displayed bosses, just click on their icon to open it.

gamenews.headline: Webshop
message: In the Tibia Webshop you can order Premium Time, Tibia Coins or Extra Services for your account. Various payment methods are availablefor your purchases.
Clickon your account page to open your account management.
Use the navigation bar or scroll down to go to the sectionProducts Availablefrom where you can access the Tibia Webshop or redeem a game code.
Click one of these three buttons to open the respective section of the Webshop:
If no country is preselected or to change the selected country, please use the drop-down menu. All prices are shown in the currency of the country you have selected.
<table style="height: 258px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 657px;" cellpadding="5">
(1) Click on one of the tabs to navigate through the Webshop and check which products are available.
(2) Select the product you would like to purchase by clicking on it.
Now you can see all payment methods you can use to purchase this product.
The price for the product you have selected may vary depending on the payment method you choose.
ClickNextto proceed once you have selected the product and payment method of your choice.
<table style="height: 174px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 635px;" cellpadding="5">

<td style="width: 222px; height: 198px;" valign="middle">You will now be asked to enter payment data depending on the payment method you selected. Hover over the question marks to get additional info about the data you need to enter.
All data you entered will be shown so please check it thoroughly.
<table style="height: 207px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 623px;" cellpadding="5">
(1) If everything has been entered correctly, check this box to accept the Extended Tibia Service Agreement and the Tibia Privacy Policy.
(2) When you are ready to submit your order, clickBuy Now.
On the last page, you will receive a summary of your order and see whether or not it was successful.
Depending on the payment method, you may also be provided with further instructions (e.g. payment details for bank transfers, redirection to payment providers).
You bought a game code from one of our official resellers?
Click the buttonUse Game Codein the sectionProducts Availableon your account management page to redeem it.
(1) Enter the 20-digit code. Make sure to enter all letters and numbers correctly.
(2) ClickNextto proceed. If you have entered a valid, correct game code,
the code will be shown to you on the next page together with the service for which it is valid.
If everything is correct, clickNextagain to activate the code.

gamenews.headline: Quest Log and Tracker
message: <center>The quest log and the quest tracker provide valuable information to navigate quests.
You can open your quest log via the respective shortcut button or by pressing Ctrl+U.
<table style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 49.7336%; height: 198.344px;" border="0"><colgroup><col style="width: 78.512%;"><col style="width: 21.4893%;"></colgroup>
Once you have started a quest, its name will appear in the quest log under the section "Quest Lines".
Click on a quest to the individual missions it contains in the upper box on the right-hand side.
Click on a mission to see details of this task in the box below.
Completed quests and missions are marked by a green tick.
You can pin quests to the top of the list by clicking this little pin button:
You can also manually hide quests from the list by clicking this little eye button:
This checkbox allows you to toggle between showing completed quests or removing them from the list:
If you tick the checkbox below you can display all your hidden quests:
You can sort quests alphabetically or by completion status.
You can use the search field to find quests by name.
<table style="height: 202px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 496px;" cellpadding="5">
You can easily track your quest progress via the quest tracker window in your sidebar.
Open your quest log and click on the button "Quest Tracker" in the lower left corner toopen the quest trackerin your sidebar.
To add a quest to it, simply go to the quest of your choice in the quest log, select the task or mission you want to track and tick the small box "Show in quest tracker".
<table style="height: 309px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 704px;" cellpadding="5">
To remove a quest from the quest tracker, right-click on its entry and selectRemove.

Quests that are accepted are automatically added to the tracker, completed quests are automatically removed. These settings are activated by default. You can change them in the quest tracker's context menu.
Click the small button in the upper right corner to open it.
There, you can also remove all currently tracked entries or all completed quests at once via the quest tracker menu.
Free account players can track up to five quests at once per character, Premium players can track up to 20 quests at once per character.

gamenews.headline: Item Cyclopedia
message: <center>The Item Cyclopedia provides useful information about most tradable items in Tibia.
Click on the respective control button to open the Tibia Cyclopedia and select the Items tab.
<table style="height: 346px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 635px;" cellpadding="5">
Browse through the various categories (1) or use the search function (2) to find the item you are interested in.

Click on an item to get further details such as the description and stats of the item, as well as info on NPCs buying or selling this item for which price and where. In addition, you will also see the average Market price of this item on your game world.
<table style="height: 100px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 635px;" cellpadding="5">
You can choose whether the NPC buy value or the average Market value should be used for item price calculations in various analytics tools.
If you have premium status, you can also set your own loot value for each item.
If you have selected an item and check this box, the item will be tracked during your character's hunting session.
For more information on item tracking, check the Compendium entry aboutAnalytics Toolsunder Client Features.
You can also add an item to your skipped loot list if you check this box.
For more information on skipped loot, check the Compendium entry about Quick Looting under Client Features.

gamenews.headline: Depot Chest and Inboxes
message: <center>Depots can be found in all major cities in Tibia. Visit them to access your stored items.
Click on a locker in a depot to open your character's personal depot locker.
It contains your depot chest, your Supply Stash, your inbox, and grants you access to the Market.
<table style="height: 159px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 636px;" cellpadding="5">
Depot Chest and Depot Boxes
Click on the depot chest in your locker to open it. You can access your depot chest from any depot.
It contains 17 numbered depot boxes in which you can store your items.
If you are a free account player you can store up to 2,000 items in your depot chest. Premium players are allowed to store a maximum of 15,000 items.

Until December 2015, each city had its own depot chest which you could only access from the city's depot. With the winter update 2015, we introduced theglobal depotand thus, the depot chest of each city turned into a numbered depot box inside the global depot chest.
If you are looking for items you had stored in a city depot before that update, simply check its corresponding depot box. You can find out its number in the list to the right.
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 648px;" cellpadding="5">
Click on the mailbox in your locker to acces your inbox. If you have received any parcels or letters, they will arrive here.
Also, if you have lost a house, your items will be transferred to your inbox. Further, all items you have bought via the Market will arrive in your inbox.
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 648px;" cellpadding="5">
Please note that your mail inbox is different from your Store Inbox.

The Store inbox contains items you have bought in the Store or received as daily reward. You can open the Store inbox wherever you are by clicking on this small button next to the helmet slot of your inventory.
You are looking for a specific item in your locker but cannot remember where you put it?
You can search for items by name if you click on this small magnifier icon.
<table style="height: 150px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="168" cellpadding="5">
You do not need to type the full name to get results.
Tick the box "Show Locker only" if you only want to see items that you own.
After clicking on "Show search result" at the bottom right,
you can see whether the items are located in your depot boxes, stash or inbox.
You can retrieve all items at once by clicking "Retrieve displayed Items" or you can retrieve a single item with drag-and-drop.
You can also use filter options such as the NPC trader filter to only display items meeting this criteria.

gamenews.headline: The Market
message: <center>The Market allows you to trade items and Tibia Coins with other players.
Open the Market by clicking on the respective button in your depot locker.
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 648px;" cellpadding="5">
Browse through the various categories (1) or use the search (2) to find the item you are interested in.
Select an item in the object list below Categories to see its current sell and buy offers sorted by the piece price.
The average item prices are calculated on a daily basis for each game world.
Sell offers that are 25 % or more above a game world's average price are displayed inred, as are buy offers that are 25 % or more below the average.
If you lack the money or items to accept a sell or buy offer, this offer will be greyed out.
For more details on the selected item, including trading statistics of the last 30 days, click on theDetailsbutton in the lower right corner of the Market window.
1) Select an item and clickSellin theCreate Offersection. You can only sell items that are stored in your depot chest.
2) Enter thePiece Priceyou want to charge for one unit of the item you are about to offer.
3) Select the number of item units you want to sell via the sliderAmount. To increase the slider's step size, hold Shift, Ctrl or Shift+Ctrl while using the slider.
4) Tick the boxAnonymousif you do not want to reveal that you are the creator of this offer.
5) If you have entered everything correctly, click onCreateto place the offer.

You can only place a sell offer if you have enough gold to pay the fee. Hover over your balance in the lower left corner of the Market window to see how much you have in cash and in your bank account.
How to accept a SELL offer to buy something from someone else:
1) Select an item and click on the offer of your choice in theSell Offerslist.
2) Set the number of item units you want to buy via the sliderAmount.
3) Check the total amount you will have to pay and click onAcceptto seal the deal.
1) Select an item and clickBuyin theCreate Offersection. You can only place a buy offer if you have enough gold to pay the fee and your offered price.
2) Enter thePiece Priceyou are willing to spend on one unit of the item you want to buy.
3) Select the number of item units you want to buy via the sliderAmount. To increase the slider's step size, hold Shift, Ctrl or Shift+Ctrl while using the slider.
4) Tick the boxAnonymousif you do not want others to know that you are the creator of this offer.
5) If you have entered everything correctly, click onCreateto place the offer.
Items from the Market will be transferred directly to your mail inbox which you access via your depot locker.
How to accept a BUY offer to sell something to someone else:
1) Select an item and click on the offer of your choice in theBuy Offerslist. You can only sell items that are stored in your depot chest.
2) Set the number of item units you want to sell via the sliderAmount.
3) Check the total amount you will earn and click onAcceptto seal the deal.
Check the sectionMy Offersto get an overview of your current offers and your offer history.

gamenews.headline: Premium Features
message: Further information on Premium Time and these benefits can be found on ourwebsite.

gamenews.headline: Quick Looting
message: <center>Use quick looting to loot more efficiently and customise it to your liking.
Quick looting allows you to loot all items in a monster corpse with a single click.
If you use Classic Controls, you can choose between the following mouse options to quick loot:
If you use Left Smart-Click, you quick loot all items if you press Alt + left click on a corpse.
If you use Regular Controls, you quick loot all items if you press Shift + right click on a corpse.
As a premium player, you can also loot a specific item within a corpse with a single click:
If you use the animated mouse cursor, a special icon will indicate quick looting. You can activate this cursor in the Options menu.
If you tick off the optionShow Loot HighlightingunderGame Windowin the Options menu, unlooted corpses will be visually highlighted.

The effect disappears as soon as any player eligible for loot either a) opens the corpse, b) quick-loots the corpse or c) the corpse expires. The highlight does not appear for empty corpses, player corpses and cooperative loot from bosses.
Set up the hotkey of your choice to easily grab loot as you walk through hunting grounds.
You can loot all fields directly beneath and adjacent to your character (9 fields, up to 30 corpses at once, per field) with a single click.
Premium status allows you to refine quick looting with two filters: Skipped Loot and Accepted Loot.
While you can only use one of the two filters at a time, you can switch between the two of them as you please.
You can access it via the Cyclopedia, the context menu of a container or a hotkey which you can assign in the Hotkey section of the Options menu.
ChooseSkipped Lootto exclude certain items from quick looting:

<td style="width: 239px; vertical-align: top;">(A) You can add an item to your Skipped Loot list via an item's context menu. Once added, you can remove that item from the list again via its context menu.
<td style="width: 254px; vertical-align: top;">(B) You can also add or remove items via the "Skip when Quick Looting" tick box in the Item Cyclopedia.

ChooseAccepted Lootto only quick loot items that you have added to your accepted loot list. You can add an item to your Accepted Loot list or remove it via the item's context menu, similar to how it works with the Skipped Loot list.
You can also remove an item on the right-hand side of the Manage Loot Containers dialog by clicking the X-button.
You can add up to 500 items to both your skipped loot list and your accepted loot list.

gamenews.headline: Bestiary and Charms
message: <center>Gather useful details about Tibian creatures in the Bestiary to unlock hunting benefits.
You can access the Bestiary via the respective tab in the Tibia Cyclopedia.
Here, you can see various creature classes in Tibia, the total number of creatures in each class and how many of them you have already killed at least once.
Click on a class to see all creatures within that class.
A creature is considered unknown to you if you have not killed it at least once after the winter update 2017.
As soon as you kill a creature for the first time, it will be displayed with its name and in colour
Click on a coloured creature to see details about it.
On a creature's detailed page, you see its difficulty level and a kill counter.
It tells you how many times you need to kill this creature to unlock further details.
A creature's difficulty determines the number of kills you need to unlock the three stages of detail.
Each stage provides additional information such as basic stats, elemental sensitivities and loot.
Very rare loot items will only be displayed if you have completed the creature's entry and looted the item at least once.
The Bestiary Tracker keeps track of your kills.
You can add a creature by ticking the box "Track Kills" in a Bestiary entry.
Charms grant various offensive, defensive, or passive bonus effects against the Bestiary creatures they are assigned to.
There are two types of charms: major and minor.
The Charms tab in the Cyclopedia provides a comprehensive overview of all charms.
There, you can unlock, upgrade, assign, and clear charms.
A creature can have both a major charm and a minor charm assigned simultaneously,
but each charm can only be assigned to one creature at a time.
Major charms are unlocked and upgraded using Charm Points, which you receive for completing a creature's Bestiary entry.
The number of Charm Points you receive depends on the creature's difficulty level.
Assign a major charm to a completed Bestiary entry to benefit from its bonus effect against that creature.
Unlocking and upgrading major charms yields Minor Charm Echoes. Use those to unlock and enhance minor charms.
Promoting your character also grants 100 Minor Charm Echoes.
Minor charms can be assigned to a creature as soon as you have unlocked stage 2 of its Bestiary entry.
Both your current Charm Points and Minor Charm Echoes, as well as their maximum capacity,
are displayed at the bottom of the Charms tab.
You can assign charms via the Charms tab or directly on a creature's completed Bestiary page.
If you want to use an assigned charm against a different creature or if you want to assign a different charm to a creature that is already linked to a charm,
you can remove the charm for a gold fee via the Charms tab or on the creature's Bestiary page.
In the Charms tab, you can also reset all of your charms
if you want to redistribute your Charm Points and Minor Charm Echoes.
Up to and including level 100, the cost is fixed at 100,000 gold.
Starting from level 101, the cost is now 100,000 gold + 11,000 gold per level.
Premium players can have six charms assigned at the same time, while free accounts can have two.
In the Store you can purchase the Charm Expansion to be able to assign all of your unlocked charms at the same time.
It also reduces the amount of gold you have to pay for clearing or resetting charms by 25%.

gamenews.headline: Winter Update 2017
message: If you would like to find out more, check therelease newson our website.

gamenews.headline: Find Person on Optional PvP
message: <center>Decide who can locate your character with the Find Person spell "exiva" on Optional PvP worlds.
<table style="height: 202px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 749px;" cellpadding="5">
Click on this icon above your chat console to open the Exiva Options dialog.
Per default, only party and guild members are allowed to use the Find Person spell on you.
This dialog allows you to customise your settings for the Find Person spell further.
You can allow it for all characters, you can allow it for pre-defined groups and you can also set up whitelists to allow the spell for specific characters or guilds.
Please note: if your guild participates in a guild war, all members of your guild, as well as the enemy guild will be able to use the Find Person spell on your character, regardless of your settings.

To add characters to your whitelist, you can either enter their names via the text field in the dialog window (A) or you can directly add single character names via the context menu in your VIP list (B).
You can even set a hotkey via the hotkey menu to toggle between the option "Allow all characters to use Exiva on me" and your previous setting for the spell:
If you use the spell on a character whom you are not allowed to locate, you will be notified in your server log.
The regular amount of mana will still be consumed when casting the spell.
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 644px;" cellpadding="5">
If someone uses the spell on you but is not allowed to locate you, a quick glow of the Exiva Options icon will inform you about the attempt.

gamenews.headline: Recovery TAN
message: <center>Add your mobile phone number to your registration to be able to change your registered email address instantly whenever you order a new recovery key.

<td style="width: 506px; vertical-align: middle;">If you add a valid mobile phone number to your registration, you will receive a recovery TAN via SMS text message whenever you order a new recovery key.
<li>If you add a valid mobile phone number to your registration, you will receive a recovery TAN via SMS text message whenever you order a new recovery key.
<li>The recovery TAN can be used to change the email address of an account instantly. A recovery TAN is only valid for 24 hours and can only be used once.
How to add a mobile phone number to your registration:
Clickon your account page to open your account management.
Use the navigation bar or scroll down to go to the sectionRegistration
<table style="height: 202px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 637px;" cellpadding="5">
Enter a valid mobile phone number in the respective line.
You also need to enter your password before you can clickSubmit to confirm the request to change your registration data.
Within the next few minutes, you should receive a verificaction TAN via SMS on your mobile phone.
<center>This verification TAN will only be valid for 15 minutes.
(1) Enter this TAN on the following page of the Change Registration Data interface.
(2) Click on Submit to verify your mobile phone number.
You can confirm your registration change after a waiting period of 30 days has passed. Please note that you need to verify your mobile phone number to be able to finalise the change.
If you do not receive a verificaction TAN via SMS, you can request a new one.
(1) Open your registration data in your account management and request a new verification TAN.

gamenews.headline: Summer Update 2018
message: If you would like to find out more, check therelease newson our website.

gamenews.headline: Cyclopedia Map
message: <center>The Cyclopedia Map is a world map of Tibia.
Discover areas to gradually unlock interesting info and details about the world.
You can open the Cyclopedia Map directly by clicking on the respective button next to the minimap.
Your character's current position is marked with a red pin on the map. This position is centered when you open the Cyclopedia map.

Use your mouse cursor to drag and drop the map in order to move it around. To zoom in and out of the map, hover your mouse cursor over the map and scroll the mouse wheel. Using the mouse wheel in combination with the SHIFT key changes the current floor.
If you want to center the map back to your character's current position, click the middle of the compass rose.
You can also use the navigation slider to switch the map to upper or lower floors.
<td style="width: 4383.5px; vertical-align: middle;">Hover your mouse cursor over the slider and scroll your mouse wheel up or down to switch floors.
A click on the blue or red section of the slider will show the map of the floor above or below you.
You can also drag and drop the slider to the map floor you would like to see.
Choose your preferred view of the map and the filter marks you would like to see displayed on the map.
The Cyclopedia Map is subdivided in different areas and subareas.
Click on the name of an area or subarea to select and highlight it on the map.
You can use the Cyclopdia Map to navigate your character.
SHIFT+Left-click in your Cyclopedia Map and your character starts walking to the desired position as long as the destination is reachable, within range and on the same layer.
2) Click the respective button to start discovering.
Points of Interest will now be randomly placed in the selected subarea. You will have to find 7 of them in order to discover the subarea completely.

If you have trouble finding enough of them, you can click the button Reset Points of Interest. All points will be randomly placed again and you can start over. Please note, though, that you will lose your current discovery progress of the subarea in question if you reset Points of Interest.
Once you have fully discovered enough subareas, you will unlock new useful features of the Cyclopedia Map:
Fully discovered at least 30% of all subareas of an area: locations of NPCs within that respective area can be shown on the map.
Fully discovered at least 70%: passages to subareas on other floor and teleports are displayed as stair symbols on the map.

Fully discovered all subareas of an area: creatures that occur in those subareas are listed when you click on a subarea's name or on a passages symbol that leads to this subarea. Creatures for which the Bestiary entry has not yet been unlocked are displayed as a silhouette.
In addition, a player who has completed an area will be notified whenever a raid is about to take place in that area within the next hour.
Visit to NPC Charos in the Adventurers' Guild to find out more about a special outfit you can unlock through discovering the Tibian world.

gamenews.headline: The Stash
message: <center>The stash offers a convenient way to stow and retrieve your items.
You can stow stackable items and most items that are tradable via the Market in your stash.
This includes brand-new rings, amulets, and gear without imbuements and tiers.
Your stash can be accessed via your depot locker.
Stow items in the stash
There are different ways to stow items in your stash:
<td style="text-align: left;">Drag & drop an item on the stash icon.
SelectStoworStow all items of this typein the item's context menu.
To stow a container's content, drag & drop it on the stash icon or selectStow container's contentfrom the context menu.
While the stash itself has no item limit, you can stow only 10,000 items at a time.
Retrieve items from the stash
click on the item and select or type the amount you want to retrieve.
Retrieved items are automatically sorted into the containers
you have selected for their category in the Manage Containersdialog.
Use predefined filters to display items of a specific item category,
and to show only those sellable to the selected NPC trader.
If you are looking for a specific item, type its name into the search bar.
You can also sort items by name, Market value, sell-to value, and quantity.
Stowed astral sources will be taken directly from your stash
if you want to imbue your equipment at an imbuing shrine.

gamenews.headline: Auto Screenshots
message: <center>Activate this feature to automatically take screenshots of important events.
The Auto Screenshots feature can be configured in the client options.
ActivateShow Advanced Optionsto access theMisccategory and the correspondingScreenshotssubcategory.
Choose if you want your whole client interface to be included in the screenshots or if you only want to capture the game window.
You can select different ingame events that will trigger an automatic screenshot.
Hover over the  button with your mouse cursor to learn more about each event.
Your local screenshots folder can be accessed via the client.
All screenshots are named after a certain pattern:
date, time, character name, event name, backlog number.
Assign a hotkey in thegeneral hotkeyssection to trigger the screenshots feature manually.

gamenews.headline: VIP List
message: The VIP list helps you to keep track of your friends and enemies.
Open VIP list: Pressor click the VIP list button to open the VIP list in your sidebar.
Enter a character's name to create the corresponding entry in your VIP list.

VIP list entries can be edited. You can assign a special icon and enter a short description. Set a check mark if you want to receive an automatic message whenever the selected character logs into the game and tick the groups you want the character to be listed in.
You can sort your VIP list by certain criteria and clear it up by hiding offline characters and group names.
Keep your VIP list neat and tidy and categorise your entries in groups. Premium players can add up to 5 additional groups to their VIP list.

gamenews.headline: Improved Respawn Rate
message: All players of a game world can donate gold to areas in order to activate a temporary improved respawn rate bonus.
Click on the map icon to open your Cyclopedia Map.
Select the area for which you want to make a donation.
On the left side you can see the current amount of gold donated for your selected area.
Enter the amount of gold you want to donate and click the "Donate" button in order to raise the gold donations of the respective area.
Hover your mouse over "Improved Respawn Rate" to see a donation overview of all areas.
The area with the highest amount of gold donations is granted the respawn bonus on a daily basis.
Furthermore, each day, one randomly drawn area receives that bonus as well.
Areas and subareas with anext to their name have an improved respawn rate bonus running.
The improved respawn rate bonus of an area is active for one server save cycle. Afterwards, that area cannot receive another bonus for at least 24 hours.
In case you are not sure to which area your hunting ground belongs, you can check the navigation tab of the Cyclopedia Map.
It displays the name of the area in which you are currently standing.

gamenews.headline: Colourised Loot Value
message: <center>Based on their gold value, items are highlighted with a coloured frame.
This allows to identify the approximate value of the item at a glance.
The colour depends on the loot value, which can be determined in theItemssection of the Cyclopedia, either using the NPC buy value, the average Market price or your own preferred value.
Each colour represents a certain gold value range:
<li>No frame means a gold value has yet to be defined in the Cyclopedia or equals 0.
• Greyframe means a gold value of 1 - 999.
• Greenframe means a gold value of 1,000 - 9,999.
• Blueframe means a gold value of 10,000 - 99,999.
• Purpleframe means a gold value of 100,000 - 999,999.
• Yellowframe means a gold value of 1,000,000+.
According to this colour pattern, the individual items in every loot message are also highlighted in the respective colour.
In case you prefer a rather subtle coloured hint in the upper left corner instead of the frames or do not want to use see value colours at all, you can change it in the client'sInterfaceoptions.

When they are nearby, their health points and mana will be displayed as well.

Click the party list button in your sidebar:
<table style="height: 150px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="168" cellpadding="5">
Party list filters allow you to show or hide members of six different groups:
players, knights, paladins, druids, sorcerers and summons.

gamenews.headline: Team Finder
message: Use the Team Finder to quickly and easily organise a hunt or find a group to play with.
Go to theAssemble Teamtab in the Social dialog.
Choose the settings which reflect what kind of team members you are looking for.
By clicking on the shield icon, you can set the level range which allows sharing XP between the lowest level player and the highest level player, with your level being in the middle.
Click onto create your notice, which also opens a chat channel.
You can then either accept, invite or reject players who want to join. Inviting them adds them to the team channel, giving you a chance to talk to them before either accepting or rejecting them.
Go to theJoin Teamtab in the Social dialog.
Choose the settings which reflect what kind of team you are looking for.
Once you have found a team you would like to join, selectJoin Team.
You will be notified once you have been accepted, invited or rejected. In case you are accepted or invited to the team, you will automatically join the team channel.

gamenews.headline: Client Settings and Minimap Export and Import
message: Use the export and import function to easily backup your client settings and minimap.

UnderHelpin the options menu you can find the buttonsExport All Options, which exports your settings (including hotkeys) and action bars, as well asExport Minimap, which lets you export your current minimap.
Import Options/Minimapallows you to import both options and minimap after export.

gamenews.headline: Character Auctions
message: Character auctions allow you to sell your own characters or acquire other players' characters.
How to auction a character
On the bottom of the Store is a button that will open a dialog in which you can set up an auction to sell the character with which you are logged in.
On the first page, you can check if all required conditions to sell this character are fulfilled. If you only see green checkmarks, you may click onNext.
On the next page, the auction can be individualised, with several options to do so:
Set the starting price of the auction. It has to be at least 57 Tibia Coins.

Choose at which day and time the auction should end. Note that yourlocal timeis displayed there. The length of the auction must be between one and 29 days from the server save following the set-up of the auction.
Select up to 4 of your rarest and most valuable items to be prominently displayed in the Char Bazaar.
Select up to 5 of your best skills, your greatest achievements or other outstanding features of your character to be prominently displayed in the Char Bazaar.
All other relevant information about your character will be displayed in the Char Bazaar's auction details.
Finally on the last page, you can recheck your auction set-up. Read everything carefully.

If you have selected everything correctly and you are sure that you want to put up this character for auction,Confirmyour choice. Go back to aPreviouspage to change your current set up. If you have changed your mind and do not want to sell this character any longer, simplyCancelthis set-up.

Once the auction has been set up, you can no longer access the character to change it in any way, as you will be logged out and can no longer log on your character. If you want to cancel the auction, you have to use the account management on the website.
The auction itself will be hosted on the Tibia website in the section Char Bazaar.
For more information on the auctioning process, please take a look at theFAQ.
How to bid on a character

Bids are submitted on the Tibia website in the section Char Bazaar. Every relevant character detail is visible in the auction details. In this section you can not only bid on characters, but also watch auctions you are particularly interested in or see auctions which have ended in the last 30 days.

If you want to bid for a character, you can submit a bid limit, which has to be at least as high as the minimum bid or higher than the current bid, in case somebody has already bid on the character. Even though your bid limit may be much higher than the minimum or current bid, you only bid as much as you need in order to have the highest bid.
Once you have clicked onSubmit Bid, read carefully before finally confirming your bid.

Once the auction has ended and you hold the highest bid, the price will be paid automatically if you have sufficient funds. If you lack the necessary funds, you have 7 days to pay the selling price. When paid, the character will appear in your character list after the next server save.
For more information on the bidding process, please take a look at theFAQ.

gamenews.headline: Tibiadrome
message: The Tibiadrome allows you to prove your combat skills in arena fights against creatures. A variety of rewards await you.
Tibiadromes can be found in Ankrahmun, Edron, Kazordoon, Rathleton, and Thais.
Up to five characters of at least level 50 can fight in the arena.
<li>There is no death penalty, no stamina drain, and no skill or level progression.
<li>Potions, runes, and ammunition are not consumed.
In the arena, you will fight against waves of special drome monsters.
The composition is randomly chosen from five different archetypes.
They do not yield experience points and do not carry loot.
A wave lasts a maximum of 120 seconds.
You need to kill all monsters in time to advance to the next wave.
The difficulty of a fight in the Tibiadrome scales via group size and current wave level.
The more players participate in the fight, the more creatures will spawn.
The higher the wave level, the stronger the creatures.
Clearing a wave raises your starting level and your drome level by one.
Your starting level indicates the wave you will start from when you enter the arena.
For a group, it is set by the lowest starting level of any participant.
Your drome level corresponds to the last wave you completed.
It also determines how many drome points you get to exchange for rewards.
Once you leave the arena, you have to wait 60 minutes before you can enter again.
For each rotation, two combat modifiers are randomly selected from this pool:
All melee monsters have a 15% chance to teleport to the furthest player.
Upon death, monsters trigger an AoE on the last hitter and all players around for 25% of their current HP.
Monsters explode in an AoE upon death, hitting all players around for 40% of their current HP.
Monsters that drop below 25% health increase their power as if they were 5 wave levels higher.
Every 15 seconds 100 random fields are marked. After 3 seconds, all players on them take damage equal to 60% of the current HP.
Every 15 seconds 100 random fields are marked. After 3 seconds, all players on them get teleported to a random position in the arena.
Every 15 seconds 100 random fields are marked. After 3 seconds, all players on them get superdrunk for 10 seconds.
Every 20/17/14/11/8 seconds, depending on the number of participants, a seed will spawn. If no player steps on it within 6 seconds it will explode and fear all players for 2 seconds.
Every 20/17/14/11/8 seconds, depending on the number of participants, a seed will spawn. If no player steps on it within 6 seconds it will explode and root all players for 3 seconds.
You can check the currently active modifiers on the modifier board in the Tibiadrome.
Each rotation lasts two weeks. Once it is over, your drome level resets to zero.
Also, you starting level will be reduced by five.
You can check your current rotation ranking in theleaderboardof your game world.
There is also a highscore for the drome score accumulated over time.
<table style="height: 159px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 636px;" cellpadding="5">
At the end of a rotation, the top 20 in the leaderboard of each game world will be rewarded with one or more powerful potions.
Also, a number of potions will be raffled off among the rest. Higher drome levels increase winning chances.
<table style="height: 159px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 636px;" cellpadding="5">
If you cleared at least one wave during a rotation, you will receive drome points at its end.
You can exchange them for decorative items, a mount, an outfit, or a drome cube containing one of the special potions.

gamenews.headline: Mount and Outfit Presets
message: The Customise Character dialog allows for the creation of presets with which you can quickly change your appearance.
Right-click on your character and chooseCustomise Character.

To create a new preset, click on the radio button next to Preset and then onNewunder Manage Presets. The new preset will appear in the list on the right. The colours of the outfit, the mount, and the familiar will be saved.
If you change your appearance and click onSave, the selected preset will be overwritten with the new configuration.
"Copy (colours)" copies the colours of your outfit or colourisable mount to clipboard.
"Paste (colours)" applies the colours you saved to clipboard.
"Copy (all)" copies the information about your outfit, colours, mount, and familiar to clipboard.
You can share this saved data with others. They just need to copy it to their clipboard and use "Paste (all)" to apply your configuration.

gamenews.headline: Exaltation Forge
message: <center>The Exaltation Forge allows players to upgrade weapons, armour, and helmets with powerful effects. Items can be increased in tiers, with the maximum number of tiers for an item being limited by its classification into one of four groups.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
<table style="height: 242px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 485px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">
<td style="width: 228px;" valign="middle">The Exaltation Forge lies north of the Adventurers' Guild.
<table style="height: 152px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 594px;" width="560" cellpadding="5">
In order to make use of the forge, resources are required. The first one isdust. In order to get dust, which is non-tradable, players have to killinfluencedmonsters.

These creatures have a low chance to spawn in place of a regular monster and are stronger versions of regular monsters. The higher the number below their name, the stronger they are, and the higher the potential to yield more dust.
<table style="height: 155px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 584px;" width="560" cellpadding="5">
Fiendishmonsters are even stronger than influenced monsters. They also give more dust, as well as a new tradable resource calledslivers.
Fiendish monsters are much rarer than influenced monsters. The spell Find Fiend indicates the direction to the nearest fiendish creature.
<table style="height: 277px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 655px;" width="619" cellpadding="5">
A player can only carry 100 dust at first, but this limit can be increased to a maximum of 325 by spending dust.
Dust can also be converted into slivers, and slivers can be converted into exalted cores.
<table style="height: 200px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 400px;" cellpadding="5">
Upgrading an item through the Exaltation Forge provides it with the following effects:
<li style="text-align: left;">Onslaught (for weapons): An attack may deal 60% bonus damage, which is additive to critical hits.
<li style="text-align: left;">Ruse (for armour): Provides a chance of completely avoiding damage from an attack.

<li style="text-align: left;">Momentum (for helmets): Grants a chance every two seconds to reduce all existing spell cooldowns by two seconds if the battle sign is present. This affects individual spell cooldown and the secondary group cooldown, but not the primary group cooldown.

<li style="text-align: left;">Transcendence (for legs): Provides a chance to transform into the vocation's Avatar Stage 3 for seven seconds, turning hits into formidable critical strikes and reducing the damage received.
<li style="text-align: left;">Amplification (for boots): This passive bonus amplifies the effect of tiered items you have equipped by increasing their trigger chance.
A higher tier increases the trigger chance of these effects.
<table style="height: 303px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 879px;" width="700" cellpadding="5">
Two of the same item need to be fused, in addition to a sum of gold (higher tiers demand higher prices), and 100 dust.

Success of a fusion is not guaranteed; there is a possibility that the second item will be either reduced by one tier, or, in case it was a tier 0 item, it will be destroyed. Using exalted cores, the success of the operation can be increased, however, and the risk of losing a tier gets reduced, should the fusion fail.

For items of classification 4,Convergence Fusionenables you to fuse different objects of the same body slot with guaranteed success. This option is available for a substantially increased gold cost, reflecting its benefit.
<table style="height: 294px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 930px;" width="700" cellpadding="5">

A a tier can be transferred from another item of the same classification. The target item, which is to receive the tier, has to be tier 0, while the source item, from which the tier is transferred, has to be at least tier 2. This process requires 100 dust, one exalted core, and a sum of gold.
The transfer is guaranteed to succeed. The target item receives the source item's tier by a reduction of one tier, while the source item itself will be destroyed during the transfer.
For items of classification 4,Convergence Transferallows you to transfer a tier without tier loss. This option is available for a substantially increased gold cost, reflecting its benefit.
