gamenews.headline: Tibia Observer App
message: <center>The Tibia Observer is a notification app that will support you in your Tibia activities. You can set up in-app and push notifications to keep yourself informed about things which matter to you.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
The Tibia Observer app is available for download in theGoogle Play storeand in theApp store.
It provides the following useful information and neat features:
<table style="height: 556px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 590px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">

<li>Useful Char Info: Is your character still online training? Have you collected your daily reward? Is your stamina full? And what is today's boosted creature and bossted boss? Tibia Observer's dashboard shows it all at a glance.
<li>Raids: Let yourself be notified about raid announcements from the Cyclopedia map if you have unlocked the respective area.
<li>Events: The app can remind you about upcoming boost events such as double XP/skill, as well as world events.
<li>Char Bazaar: Create a search for characters you are interested in and receive a notification once a fitting auction is up.
<li>Offline Training: Optimise your offline training by staying notified about your characters training time pool.
<li>Mini World Changes: Get informed about active mini world changes on server save.
<li>Houses: The Tibia Observer can let you know when your dream house is up for auction.
<li>News and Forum: Stay up to date on latest news, replies in one of your own threads and follow the CM tracker.
No password or other sensitive data is needed and stored on your smartphone.
More information on the app can also be found in the respectiveFAQs.

gamenews.headline: Bosstiary
message: Check which bosses you have killed and how often, and earn cool benefits for making progress.
You can access the Bosstiary via the respective tab in the Tibia Cyclopedia.
The first kill of a boss opens up the respective entry in the Bosstiary.
A kill only counts towards your progress if your particaption was high enough.
Depending on how often a boss can be killed within a certain amount of time,
it falls into one of three categories: Bane, Archfoe or Nemesis.
There are three progress levels you can unlock for each boss:
Prowessallows you to assign this boss to a boss slot which gives you an equipment loot bonus of 25% for this boss.
Expertiseallows you to display this boss on a Podium of Vigour in your house or guildhall.
Masterygrants you an additional 25% equipment loot bonus when this boss is assigned to a boss slot.
You also receive boss points for unlocking a new progress level.
By accumulating boss points you can gradually increase the equipment loot bonus of the boss slot.
Also, a second boss slot will be unlocked once you reach 1500 boss points.
TheBosstiary Trackerallows you to track your progress with bosses that you have defeated at least once. You can select the bosses you want to track via the Bosstiary.

The tracker also shows the cooldown of bosses: A white hourglass indicates an expired cooldown. A red hourglass indicates a cooldown that is still running. Hovering over the symbol shows the full cooldown time.
With every server save, a randomly drawn boss of the Archfoe category contains more equipment loot.
Also, one kill of this boss counts as three for your Bosstiary.
Making progress in the Bosstiary will also bestow temporary and permanent titles on your character.
Moreover, there is a highscore for "Boss Points".

gamenews.headline: Wheel of Destiny
message: <center>The Wheel of Destiny enables you to further specialise your character based on your needs and playstyle as you level up.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
<table style="height: 242px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 485px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">
The Wheel of Destiny offers something to look forward to for all promoted Premium characters above level 50.
You will gain promotion points which you can use to unlock various benefits ranging from small perks all the way up to new powerful spells and abilities depending on your vocation.
You can spend and remove points for free!

Whenever you have promotion points to spend, simply open the Wheel of Destiny and spend your points. You can do this any time. To remove or reset already invested points you have to be in a temple, though.
The Wheel of Destiny is divided into four domains. Each domain contains nine slices. So in total, there are 36 slices which you can fill with points to improve your character.

<li>Dedication Perks have small effects. They gradually increase existing characteristics, e.g. your HP or your mana. Every promotion point invested into a Dedication Perk raises the bonus in question a bit till you have assigned the maximum number of points possible for this slice.

<li>Conviction Perks have medium to large effects. They augment existing spells, grant vocation-specific passive abilities or generally useful bonuses, e.g. elemental resistance. You unlock a Conviction Perk once you have filled the respective slice to the max. Most Conviction Perks can be found more than once within the Wheel of Destiny. When they are unlocked, their effects add up.
<table style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%;" border="0"><colgroup><col style="width: 25%;"><col style="width: 25%;"><col style="width: 25%;"><col style="width: 25%;"></colgroup>

<li>Revelation Perks have powerful effects. They grant new spells or strong passive effects with considerable impact. There are four Revelation Perks and each of them is assigned to one of the four domains of the wheel. You unlock a Revelation Perk once you have spent enough promotion points in the respective domain. Spending more points in the same domain will unlock the more powerful stages two and three of this Revelation Perk.
<table style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%;" border="0"><colgroup><col style="width: 25%;"><col style="width: 25%;"><col style="width: 25%;"><col style="width: 25%;"></colgroup>
<table style="height: 242px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 485px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">

The Wheel of Destiny Presets allow you to switch between various wheel setups while you are in the temple. Presets can also be imported and exported. This means you can also share your setups with friends or transfer them to a different character.

TheWheel of Destiny Planneron the website allows you to select a vocation and freely distribute points. It also displays how many Promotion Points are required for your current specification and you will also be able to import and export your ingame setups. You can also set a limit for the points when using Planner.

gamenews.headline: Bug Reporting
message: <center>You found a bug in Tibia and want to report it? Here is how:
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
<table style="height: 80px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 557px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">
1) If you find a bug in Tibia, you can report by using the key combination Ctrl+Z.
This opens a special client dialog to report . It can also be opened via the context menu entry "Report Coordinate".
2) Select a fitting category for your bug report:
<li>If you want to report a map bug or an NPC bug, please check the report steps provided further below.
<li>Include a step by step explanation as to how to reproduce the bug.
<li>Make it as detailed as necessary and as short as possible.
<li>Focus on important information. Leave out anything which is not crucial to understand the problem.

Bug reports automatically include your character name as well as the coordinates of the map field on which your character stood when submitting the bug. You do not need to provide this information in your report.
4) Click on "Send" to submit your bug report.
The submission of your bug report will be confirmed with the message "Comment sent" in your game window and server log.
<li>To report map bugs, right-click on the map field in question.
<li>Select the entry "Report Coordinate" from the context menu.
<li>The coordinate you clicked on will be sent automatically with your report.
NPC Chat Bugs
<li>To report mistakes in NPC chats, right-click on the NPC text in question.
<li>The NPC's name and line will then be sent automatically with your report.
To be able to report bugs, your account must have accumulated at least 30loyalty points.
Each account can submit up to 5 bug reports per day.
An account can be blocked from submitting bug reports, e.g. in case of abusing the bug report function.
The bug report function is reserved exclusively for bugs, do not use it to report rule violations or illegal names!
If you see broken graphics, blue pixels, wrong automap colours, broken ground textures or strange looking wall parts, you have most likely found a map bug.
<td>You are talking to an NPC or read a dusty old parchment and some of the words do not make any sense? Congratulations, your sharp eyes have spotted a typo.

<td>An NPC is not working properly, e.g. refuses to trade or denies you access to a quest even though you fulfil the requirements? Select "Technical" in the bug report dialog to inform us about such issues.
The same goes for dead ends or loop holes in quests or world events.
<td>In case you have stumbled upon an issue that does not fit the above mentioned bugs or if you are unsure, select "Other" in the bug report dialog.

<td>Besides bugs in game, you might experience occasional client crashes during the test server. Usually, a crash report window will open once you have started the client again. Please describe the situation you were in when the crash occurred or if the usage of a specific client feature can provoke such crash. Sending the crash report is very important since it provides us with valuable insights about the cause.
<table style="height: 80px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="253" cellpadding="5">

gamenews.headline: Wheel of Destiny: Gem Atelier
message: <center>The Gem Atelier in the Wheel of Destiny offers expansive ways to amplify your character's power.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
Archfoe bosses, influenced and fiendish creatures can drop gems for each vocation:
Guardian gems for knights, marksman gems for paladins, sage gems for sorcerers and mystic gems for druids.
You can either trade gems or reveal those for your vocation in the Gem Atelier.
You can access it by opening the Wheel of Destiny and clicking on the tab "Gem Atelier".
There, you can reveal gems to discover their inherent powers, thus binding them to your character.
This means they can no longer be traded or given to other characters.
<table style="height: 399px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 646px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">
<table style="height: 204px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 769px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">
Gems come in three sizes granting various boosts for your character:
<li>Lesser gems have 1 basic mod: stats (HP, mana, capacity, mitigation multiplier), basic resistances (fire, earth, energy, ice) or stat + basic resistance (e.g. HP + fire resistance)
<li>Regular gems have 2 basic mods: resistances (basic resistances, holy, death, physical, mana drain, life drain)
<li>Greater gems have 2 basic mods and 1 supreme mod: critical extra damage, life leech, mana leech, dodge, spell augments, revelation mastery
To enjoy the bonuses of gem mods, place the gem in the vessel that matches its domain affinity.
The activation of mod bonuses depends on how manyVessel Resonanceperks you have filled in this domain of the wheel:
The Wheel of Destiny consists of four domains.
When a gem is revealed, it not only gains mods but also a colour representing its domain affinity.
You can switch the domain affinity of a gem clockwise for gold.
<table style="height: 119px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 769px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">
<li>None: Sealed vessel, no mod active. (bottom right in the image above)
<li>One: Dormant vessel, first mod active. (bottom left in the image above)
<li>Two: Awakened vessel, first and second mod active. (top left in the image above)
<li>Three: Radiant vessel, all mods active, including supreme mods. (top right in the image above)
Active mods are displayed with their icon in the Vessel Resonance perks in the wheel.
To the left you see a perk without an active Mod, to the right you see it with an active Mod:
If the Vessel Resonance matches the size of the gem you have placed into this vessel,
you will gain a bonus of +1 to both Damage and Healing for lesser and regular gems.
Placing a greater gem into a radiant vessel will increase this bonus to +2.
Gems can be locked or unlocked by clicking on the small lock icon located at the top left corner of the gem.
When a gem is locked, you cannot change its domain or destroy it.
Via the Button "Dismantle", you can dismantle gems that you do not need anymore.
Fragments can be used to enhance your mods in the Fragment Workshop.
You cannot dismantle gems that are locked, placed in a vessel, or are the last one you have of a particular domain.
<table style="height: 242px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 485px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">

You can check a list of all available mods in theWheel of Destiny Planneron the website by selecting a vocation and then clicking in one of the four vessels. In the dropdown lists, you can see which mods are available for each mod slot.

gamenews.headline: Manage Containers
message: <center>How to quickly manage and arrange the contents of your backpacks:
Premium players can use theManage Containersdialog to assign categories to containers.
Items obtained from looting, NPCs, the depot and the stash are then automatically placed in their assigned containers.
You can open the dialog via the context menu of a container, the Cyclopedia, or a configurable hotkey.
Under "Loot", you manage the containers for items looted from creatures.
Under "Obtain", you manage containers for items obtained through other means.
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 648px;" cellpadding="5">
To assign a categoy, press the crosshairs button next to it and click on the container of your choice. Done!
From now on, items of this category will be automatically put into that container.
To remove a category from a container, simply press the X button next to the category in the Manage Containersdialog.
You can assign multiple categories to the same container.
If you hover over the small bag icon in the lower right corner of a container that has at least one category assigned to it, these categories will be displayed.
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 644px;" cellpadding="5">
Items of categories you have not assigned to a specific container, will be placed into the Unassignedcontainer for looted and obtained items.
Per default, this is your main container, the one you have equipped in the body slot. You can also select different containers via the Manage Containers dialog.
<table style="height: 102px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 644px;" cellpadding="5">
You can sort the contents of your backpacks according to various criteria by opening the respective menu.
Sorting options include sorting ascending/descending by name, weight, expiry and stack size.

Additionally, you can sort nested containers, prioritise backpacks to be sorted first within the inventory, and you can switch on the manual sort mode to be able to drag and drop items to any location within the backpack.

gamenews.headline: The Soulpit
message: <center>Conquer the very soul of a creature in the Soulpit to unlock its Animus Mastery, a permanent experience boost.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
<td style="text-align: left; width: 85%; padding: 5px; vertical-align: middle;">
Whenever you kill a fiendish creature, you have a chance to obtain its soul core. Rarely, it may also drop the soul core of an uncommon, rare, or very rare creature within the same Bestiary class.
A soul core is your key to a challenging fight against stronger versions of this creature in the Soulpit.
You can transform a soul core into another one that might better suit your preferences.
1) Soul Prism + Soul Core = Transforms a soul core into one of the next higher Bestiary difficulty.
+=
Soul prisms can be looted from fiendish creatures.
2) Exalted Core + Soul Core = Transforms a soul core into one of the next lower Bestiary difficulty.
+=
Exalted cores can be obtained by converting slivers at the Exaltatation Forge.
3 )Soul Core + Soul Core = Combines two soul cores into a random soul core of any Bestiary difficulty.
+=
The Soulpit is located in the north-eastern part of Hrodmir.
<table style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 8.82179%; height: 122.391px; border-width: 0px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" border="0"><colgroup><col style="width: 100%;"></colgroup>
Enter the ice skull and use the obelisk inside with a soul core to get teleported into the pit.
Only one soul core is needed to teleport a group of up to 5 players.
Prepare to fight four increasingly difficult waves of descendants of the soul core creature.
In the final wave, a particularly strong specimen challenges you with one of three special abilities:
<td style="width: 289.719px; text-align: center; height: 180.391px; vertical-align: middle;">
The creature's damage and resilience increases as its vitality wanes
<td style="width: 289.719px; text-align: center; vertical-align: top; height: 180.391px;">
<td style="width: 289.719px; text-align: center; height: 67.391px; vertical-align: middle;">
Can leave you hexed, simultaneously feared and rooted, or powerless
<td style="width: 289.719px; text-align: center; vertical-align: top; height: 67.391px;">
<td style="width: 289.719px; text-align: center; height: 180.391px; vertical-align: middle;">
Allows your enemy to torture you with sudden spikes in damage.
<td style="width: 289.719px; text-align: center; vertical-align: top; height: 180.391px;">
You have 10 minutes to complete the entire challenge. Be careful! The regular death penalty applies in the Soulpit.
Soulpit creatures do not drop loot or dust, they are not tameable or skinnable, and they do not count towards kill counters or kill statistics.
Soulpit creatures in the first three waves do not yield XP.
Defeating the final wave and thereby completing the challenge will grant you 2800% more XP than killing the usual creature.
It also unlocks the creature's animus mastery for all participants present at the time of success: You now benefit of a permanent XP bonus of 2% for that creature.
You can increase this bonus up to 4%:
It will increase by 0.1% for every 10 animus masteries you unlock.
The maximum bonus of 4% is reached when you have mastered 200 different creatures.
You can also earn a title, an achievement and a special keepsake for unlocking animus mastery for numerous creatures.

gamenews.headline: Wheel of Destiny: Fragment Workshop
message: <center>The Fragment Workshop allows you to upgrade mods to harness the full power of your gems.
<table style="height: 23px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" width="55" cellpadding="5">
You can access the Fragment Workshop by opening the Wheel of Destiny and clicking on the respective tab.
There, you can enhance your gem mods from Grade I to Grade IV to increase their power.
These upgrades require gold and fragments. Fragments are remnants of shattered gems.
Gems can be looted from Archfoe bosses, influenced and fiendish creatures.
<table style="height: 142.391px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 646px;" width="500" cellpadding="5">
To obtain fragments, you can either crush unrevealed gems with acrusheroramber crusher, or you can dismantle revealed gems in the Gem Atelier.
Fragments can also be purchased from jewelry shop NPCs, though this convenient option is priced accordingly.
Depending on the quality of the gem and whether it is revealed or unrevealed, you will receive a certain number of fragments.

<table style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 52.0426%; border-width: 0px; height: 97px;" border="1"><colgroup><col style="width: 16.0944%;"><col style="width: 28.0043%;"><col style="width: 28.0043%;"><col style="width: 28.0043%;"></colgroup>
<td style="text-align: center; border-width: 0px; padding: 5px;">1-4 lesser fragments
<td style="text-align: center; border-width: 0px; padding: 5px;">2-8 lesser fragments
<td style="text-align: center; border-width: 0px; padding: 5px;">1-4 greater fragments
<td style="text-align: center; border-width: 0px; padding: 5px;">1-5 lesser fragments
<td style="text-align: center; border-width: 0px; padding: 5px;">2-10 lesser fragments
<td style="text-align: center; border-width: 0px; padding: 5px;">1-5 greater fragments
How to enhance mods in the Fragment Workshop?
If you click on a mod, you can check its unlocked and unlockable grades and their effects in the "Enhance Mod Grade" section.
It also shows how much gold and how many fragments you need to invest to unlock the next grade for this mod.
For a basic mod, you need lesser fragments; for a supreme mod, you need greater fragments.
Raising mods to their highest grade also earns you permanent promotion points:
For every Grade IV mod, you will receive an additional Promotion Point for your Wheel of Destiny.
If you enhance a mod, its grade will be raised on all gems the mod appears on.
However, the effectiveness of the enhanced mod on a gem is limited
by the grade of the mods that come before it on the gem.
If they have a lower grade, the mod in question is also limited to that lower grade.
A special icon and tooltip in the Gem Atelier inform you if the grade of an enhanced mod is limited by the grade of a preceeding mod.

gamenews.headline: Basics
message: Use arrow keys or WASD to move around and to walk on stairs.
To use WASD, make sure Chat mode is off.
The Tibia client allows you to adjust many game settings.
When you first open the Options menu, you will see only the basic ones.
To view all available settings, click "Show Advanced Options" at the bottom.
Do you prefer a mysterious atmosphere or a clear view?
You can find the slider to adjust "Ambient Light" in the Options menu under Graphics  > Effects.
Lower the slider to enjoy the subtle play of light and darkness.
Set it high for a brighter environment.
The light around you also depends on the time of day and your location.
If you uncheck the box "Show Light Effects", you will not see any light effects at all.
You can find various light sources and place them in your Extra Slot to illuminate dark places.
For example, if you have a torch equipped, click on it to light it.

gamenews.headline: Combat and Hunting
message: Click on a monster in the game window or in the battle list to attack it.
Use autoattack and attack spells to deal damage.
Press a hotkey or an action button to cast your spells.
The spells you can use depend on your vocation:
Maintain your health with healing spells and potions.
Defeat monsters to gain experience points.
When you level up, your health and mana are restored.
Search corpses for loot such as gold, food or equipment.
Press Alt+left-click or Alt+Q to loot everything from nearby corpses with a single click.
Your capacity and backpack slots limit how much your character can carry.
Your inventory shows your characters' equipment.
It is split up into individual slots, representing the locations where items can be equipped.
<table style="height: 224px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 687px;" cellpadding="5">
5) Amulet Slot: for a necklace or an amulet
6) Weapon Slot: for a weapon, e.g. sword, a bow, a rod or a wand
8) Container Slot: for a container such as a backpack
9) Shield Slot: for a shield, a spellbook or a quiver
10) Extra Slot: for useful items such as a light source
To equip an item simply move it into the slot it is intended for.
Some equipment pieces require a certain vocation or minimum level.
Regenerate faster with food
The field below your inventory shows if your character is affected by a special condition.
If you see this icon there, it means that your character is hungry.
Hungry characters regenerate health every 4 seconds and mana every 6 seconds.
boosting your regeneration to 3 seconds (health) and 5 seconds (mana).
There is plenty of food in Tibia. You can loot it, buy it in shops, harvest or cook it.
What every adventurer needs
<td style="width: 93.5836%; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;">Always carry a rope in your backpack to be able to pull yourself up from holes.
Look for rope spots, little round shadows on the floor which indicate a hole above it.
Left-click on your rope, then left-click on the shadow to pull yourself up.
<td style="width: 93.5836%; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center; height: 49px;">With a shovel, you can create holes in loose stone piles to go down one level.
Left-click on your shovel, then left-click on the stone pile to go down by opening a hole.

gamenews.headline: Life and Death
message: Your character's hit points decrease when being attacked or harmed.
If your hit points drop to zero, your character will die and respawn in the temple of your hometown.
In the challenging world of Tibia, dying is not without penalties.
Based on your level, you lose experience and skills.
After reaching level 8, you may also lose items upon death.
For promoted characters, the experience and skills loss is lowered by 30%.
Premium players can purchase a promotion at level 20 from royal figures like King Tibianus in Thais.
Blessings reduce your character's experience and skill loss upon death.
They also lower the chance of losing items.
Blessings can be purchased from certain NPCs ingame or via the Store.
A character with at least 5 blessings will not lose any items upon death.
The little ankh on the top left side of your inventory, tells you more about your blessings status:
<table style="height: 185.562px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 689px;" cellpadding="5">
Grey ankh: your character is not protected by any blessing.
Green ankh: your character is protected by all available regular blessings and the PvP blessing "Twist of Fate" provided it is available on the character's game world.
Yellow ankh: your character is protected by at least one blessing.
<table style="height: 159px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 636px;" cellpadding="5">
Click on the little ankh to open the Blessings dialog.
Here, you can check by which blessings your character is protected (1) and what factors influence the penalty for your next death (2).
Also, you can go right to the Store to purchase missing blessings by clicking on the Store button below the blessing in question.
On Open PvP game worlds, characters up to level 20 are protected by the Adventurer's Blessing.
Their inventory will be displayed with golden frames.
If your character dies in a PvP fight being protected by this blessing,
your will not lose any items, experience and skill points.
As soon as your character attacks another character first
or reaches level 21 for the first time, the blessing will be lost for good.
Then your inventory will then be displayed normally in grey.

gamenews.headline: Temple and Adventurers' Guild
message: <table style="height: 159px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 636px;" cellpadding="5">
Temples are safe places in each major city.
Inside, you can find a portal of citizenship.
Enter the teleporter to make a city your hometown.
You will now revive in this temple if you die.
Each temple has a priest who can heal you if your health is under 50.
They can also cure you from poison, burning, and other bad status effects.
When you left Newhaven, you received anadventurer's stone.
You can also ask a temple priest for a new one.
If you use this stone in a temple, you will be teleported right to the Adventurers' Guild.
There, you can find useful information and various NPCs who provide useful services.
For example, there is a banker and a shopkeeper selling basic items such as a rope and a shovel.
To return to the city you came from, use one of the two teleporters in the room you arrived in.
NPC Charos can change the destination of the teleporters to a city of your choice.
You can use this service 6 times in total.

gamenews.headline: Promotion
message: At level 20, your character can buy a promotion if your account has Premium status.
This is an elite rank for your vocation.
Depending on your vocation, you are promoted to
Besides receiving this title, a promoted character enjoys the following benefits:
<li>experience and skill loss upon death is reduced by 30%
<li>higher regeneration of hit points and mana
<li>an extra spell unique to the vocation
<li>double the soul points with quicker soul point regeneration
Promotions can be bought for 20,000 gold pieces at royal figures in Tibia:
<td style="width: 74.3243%; vertical-align: middle; height: 51.3906px; text-align: left;">King Tibianus III of Thais
<td style="width: 74.3243%; vertical-align: middle; height: 64.3906px; text-align: left;">Queen Eloise of Carlin
<td style="width: 74.3243%; vertical-align: middle; height: 64.3906px; text-align: left;">Emperor Kruzak of Kazordoon
<td style="width: 74.3243%; vertical-align: middle; height: 64.3906px; text-align: left;">Grand Vizier Ishebad of Ankrahmun
<td style="width: 74.3243%; vertical-align: middle; height: 64.3906px; text-align: left;">Emperor Rehal of Beregar
<td style="width: 74.3243%; vertical-align: middle; height: 64.3906px; text-align: left;">Rotem Valos of the Adventurers' Guild
Talk to any of these NPCs and ask them topromoteyou.
If you meet the following conditions, you will be instantly promoted:
<li>You have the required amount of 20,000 gold.
If your Premium status expires, promoted characters lose their elite rank and benefits.
However, these are restored without additional fees once you upgrade to Premium again.

gamenews.headline: Influenced and Fiendish Creatures
message: <center>Influenced and fiendish creatures are more dangerous but offer exclusive loot.
Influenced and fiendish creatures have a low chance to spawn in place of a regular monster.
They are stronger versions of regular monsters, empowered by Sinister Embrace.
<td style="text-align: left; width: 85%; padding: 5px; vertical-align: middle;">
The number below an influenced creature's name shows its Sinister Embrace stacks.
The higher the number, the stronger they are and the higher the potential to yield more dust.
Dust is a non-tradable resource required for using the Exaltation Forge in Tibia.
You can only get dust by killing influenced creatures.
Fiendish monsters are much rarer than influenced monsters.
You can use the spellFind Fiendto locate them.
Beware though! They are much stronger than influenced monsters.
Their power equals that of an influenced creature with 15 stacks,
indicated by the exclamation mark below their name.
<td style="text-align: left; width: 85%; padding: 5px; vertical-align: middle;">
Fiendish yield more dust, and you can also loot a tradable resource calledslivers.
Whenever you kill a fiendish creature, you also have a chance to obtain a soul core.
You can use it in the Soulpit to fight increasingly difficult waves of the soul core creature.
If you are successful, you unlock Animus Mastery for this creature, a permanent experience boost.
Influenced and fiendish creatures can drop gems for each vocation:
Guardian gems for knights, marksman gems for paladins,
sage gems for sorcerers and mystic gems for druids.
Gems come in three sizes: lesser, regular and greater.
You can either trade these gems with other players,
or reveal those for your vocation in the Gem Atelier.
There, you can place them in your Wheel of Destiny to amplify your character's power.

gamenews.headline: Weapon Proficiency
message: <center>Upgrade your favourite weapons through the new Weapon Proficiency system.
You can access the Weapon Proficieny tree via the context menu of a specific weapon or via the respective shortcut button.
Each proficiency has up to seven levels, offering one to three unlockable perks per level.
Equip a weapon and kill Bestiary creatures and bosses to increase your proficiency with this weapon.
The higher the Bestiary difficulty of a creature, the more proficieny progress you gain from it.
Only one perk per Proficiency Level can be active at a time
Selecting a perk for your weapon can be done anywhere, but changing or removing a perk is only possible in protection zones.

Please also note: With the introduction of the Weapon Proficiency system, all characters now have a default critical hit chance of 5% and 10% critical extra damage. Any additional crit chance gained from items is added on top. Monsters have received a 1% critical hit chance for auto attacks. To maintain balance in the game, weapons no longer provide any critical hit chance in their basic version.
The Weapon Proficiencies interface allows you to check the trees of all weapons.
You can apply filters to narrow down the list.
